results.title: Drought feeding
results.brief_description: Discusses the various fuel values of different foodstuffs and gives much information on drought feeding of stock. Based on scientific investigations made by the Australian wool board into the subject of drought feeding of sheep, this film shows the fuel value of various types of supplementary fodder, taking into account both cost and nutritive value. The Wool Board makes available to pastoralists a Drought Feed Calculator, together with other tables relating to drought feeding, are clearly presented in this film.

results.title: Tour of Tasmania, February 1950
results.brief_description: Home movie travelogue of Tasmania shot in February 1950. Includes scenes of several historic buildings and sites, and of Swansea, Port Arthur, Hobart and Cataract Gorge. No credits available.

results.title: Bush and beach around Melbourne
results.brief_description:
This film is made up of various scenes of coastal and bush areas in and around Victoria: life saving display at St. Kilda; some views around the beaches to Portsea; bathers and motor boating across the bay to Queenscliff; into the nearest ranges, fields of daffodils around Healesville, Marysville and Warburton districts; gun-dogs in action; fly-fishing; the Dandenong ranges.
No credits available.

results.title: A Record of pre-school play
results.creator_credit: Australian Council for Educational Research and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: These children are representative of 100 who commenced primary school in Carlton during 1951. Some children had attended the Lady Gowrie Pre-School Centre, some came from other kindergartens and creches and some had not attended any pre-school centre. The children were assembled for two weeks at the end of 1950 to study their vocabulary and this film was made of their unrehearsed and undirected activities. Photography by Rodney Power.

results.title: Festival of the pig
results.creator_credit: J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films
results.brief_description: Shows the villagers of New Guinea preparing for a feast in which pig is the chief item of food. Their elaborate costumes and a tribal dance are shown, while the sound track includes actual chants.
results.description: Shows the villagers of New Guinea preparing for a feast in which pig is the chief item of food. Their elaborate costumes and a tribal dance are shown, while the sound track includes actual chants.
